result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert K. Cataract was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Robert K. Cataract is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Robert K. Cataract was found guilty of Possession of synthetic cannabinoid, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(em).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If Probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of governmental agencies for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

miscConds.notes: Pay all court order obligations including County Appointed Attorney Fees (TBD) according to a schedule as previously set by the Court of $100.00 per month commencing 04-01-2015 and the first of each month thereafter until paid in full.  AMENDED:  03-23-2015 - County Appointed Attorney Fees Ordered in the amount of $151.55.
Comply with any counseling or treatment as required by Probation & Parole;

Complete probation with no violations of the rules of probation.  Any violation of a rule of probation would result in a finding that the defendant did not "successfully complete probation" within the meaning of the expungement statute and will prevent expungement even if discharged from probation.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert K. Cataract

defendant.name: Cataract, Robert K.
defendant.address: W6487 County Road P, Durand, WI 54736

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Failure to Meet Conditions for Expungement filed by DOC
Copy of payment in full to DOC filed by DOC agent.  Probation Hrg. today removed.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Order for Compensation of Court Appointed Atty.  Ordered that $151.55 be allowed to said atty as compensation of his professional service and disbursements, said sums to be paid to said Atty. by Pepin County and Pepin County shall be reimbursed by defendant as previously ordered.
Petition for Payment of County Appointed Attorney Fees

Defendant Robert K. Cataract in court with attorney John Charles Bachman.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel informs court of agreement, defendant will plead to the Operate with restricted controlled substance under guidelines and count 1, 1 yr. probation, requesting expungement.  Judge advises defendant of elements of count 1/max. penalties.  Defendant pleads no contest on count 1 in 15CM13 and no contest to 15TR37 operate with restricted controlled substance.  Court dismisses count 2 in 15CM13 and 15TR17.  Court reviews PLQ/WOR form. Court finds defendant's waiver of his constitutional rights & plea done knowingly & voluntarily, accepts plea in 15TR37 and count 1 in 15CM13 and finds defendant guilty.  15TR37 assess fine/costs $887.50; 6 mos. revocation; AA/DSP.  Defendant to continue making $100/mo. payments to be applied to atty. fees first, then fine.  Count 1 in 15CM13 w/hold sentence and place on 1 yr. probation; conditions:  pay county appt. atty fees; comply with any counseling as required by P&P.

Ordered that Attorney John Bachman is appointed to represent the defendant as defense counsel.
Further Ordered That the defendant shall reimburse the County by monthly installments of $100.00 per month commencing 04-01-2015, subsequent payments due the same day of each and every month thereafter.
Failure to make scheduled payments without a showing by the defendant of good cause shall be contempt of court punishable under Ch. 785, Wis. Stats. and the Court shall do any of the following:  See Order

Defendant Robert K. Cataract in court.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Judge advises defendant of charges/max. penalties and rights.  Defendant request County Appointed Atty, didn't qualify for SPD.  Court appointed Atty. Bachman with order to repay County.  NGP entered.  Status conference scheduled for March 17, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
